review: Screen sharing doesn't work. It's documented to have worst latency by people who have gotten it to work. I want root access to install system drivers for a few BT devices as well, but Amazon updates prevent me from getting root access. You might as well get a chromecast or other device.
author: Rahul Bhandari

review: I am not a tech-savvy person, but I do love convenience. So, when a gadget promises convenience, I weigh the benefit vs. how hard is the gadget going to be learn. My final assessment: oh, how grand the Fire TV Stick is! All of my favorite streaming channels are at my fingertips - Crackle, Netflix, Amazon Prime (obviously), and others I hadn't heard of (but are intriguing) like Drive-In Classics.Set up is basically plug in and go (I bought directly from Amazon so my account was pre-loaded). The remote is very easy to use. I also uploaded the remote app to my android phone to utilize voice search - which was also very easy.The only question I have is why did I wait so long to get it?
author: Amazon Customer
